# Probability Distributions

### Discrete distributions:

#### Binomial:

![](images/Screenshot_25-9-2025_221328_.jpeg)

```{r message=TRUE, warning=TRUE}

choose(10, 5) * 0.2^5 * 0.8^5
dbinom(5, 10, 0.2) # dbinom(x, n, p)
dbinom(5, 10, 0.5)
```

Now assume we are interested in P(4 ≤ k ≤ 7), i.e., the probability of observing 4, 5, 6 or 7 successes for B(10, 0.5).

```{r message=FALSE, warning=FALSE}

sum(dbinom(4:7, 10, 0.5))

# Alternative:

pbinom(7, 10, 0.5) - pbinom(3, 10, 0.5)
```

```{r message=FALSE, warning=FALSE}

k = 0:10
probability = dbinom(k, 10, 0.5)
plot(k, probability, ylab = 'Probability',
     main = 'DPDF', pch = 20)
```

#### Poisson:

```{r message=FALSE, warning=FALSE}

dpois(5, 2) # dpois(x, \lambda)
```

#### Probability mass function (pmf):

```{r message=FALSE, warning=FALSE}

x = seq(0, 16)
fx = dbinom(x, 16, 0.3)
binom = data.frame(x, fx)

library(ggplot2)
ggplot(binom, aes(x = x, y = fx)) +
  geom_bar(stat = 'identity', width = 0.2) +
  theme_light()
```

#### Cumulative distribution function (cdf):

```{r message=FALSE, warning=FALSE}

x1 = seq(0, 16)
fx1 = pbinom(x1, 16, 0.3)
binom1 = data.frame(x1, fx1)

ggplot(binom1, aes(x = x1, y = fx1)) +
  geom_point() +
  theme_light()
```

### Continuous distributions:

```{r message=FALSE, warning=FALSE}

dunif(5, 0 , 10) # dunif(x, a ,b)
dlogis(10) # dlogis(x)
dexp(5, 1) # dexp(x, \lambda)
dnorm(10) # dnorm(x), Std. normal
dnorm(10, 5, 0.5) # dnorm(x, \mu, \sigma)
dchisq(5, 4) # dchisq(x, d)
dt(10, 5) # dt(x, d)
df(10, 5, 4) # df(x, m, n)

pnorm(1.68)
pnorm(1.96) - pnorm(-1.96)


```

![](images/clipboard-1184130851.png)

### Random draws from probability distributions:

```{r message=FALSE, warning=FALSE}

rbinom(10, 1, 0.5)
rnorm(10)

norm = rnorm(1000000)
mean(norm)
sd(norm)

set.seed(123)
rnorm(10)

set.seed(1234)
z = data.frame(rnorm(10000))

ggplot(z ,aes(x = rnorm.10000.)) +
  geom_density() +
  theme_light()

fdist = data.frame(rf(1000000, 100, 50))
colnames(fdist) = c("f")
ggplot(fdist, aes(x = f)) +
  geom_density() +
  theme_light()
```
